boat.name: Genesta II
boat.full_description:
Abandoned in 1990 in a field, with the lid chopped off, one of four Panda 711s built. Although sandwich construction, they were built in a female mould. One is in the Clyde and another in N. Wales still with their original rig, a huge Bermudan main with a tiny jib. Another was crushed by a ship in Ramsey Harbour and was broken up.

Mick Kneale was given the remains of the hull, the top having been chopped off along the sheerline and a big hole where the keel had been removed. He has raised the the freeboard to make it into a dayboat. The watertight raised floor is made of 9mm Robins Elite ply, glassed over. She is a gaff sloop rig with alloy spars and daggerboard has a 315 kg bulb drawing 2m.
boat.construction_details: grp balsa core  plywood raised floor glassed over (self-draining)
boat.short_description: Genesta II, previously known as Ching Ching, was originally built as a small cruiser/racing yacht.
